Description: Sherd (mended from seven fragments and added plaster) of Attic black-figured pottery dinos stand, consisting of part of baluster, lower disk and stem; exterior: on baluster, black-figure decoration consisting of feet and lower bodies of two confronted birds or sirens with added red on wing bow; below, part of lower disk glazed black with added red; top of stem glazed streaky black; two animal friezes below: on upper register, parts of four geese with red on wings and grazing to left; on lower register, part of siren with red on tail to left; confronted lions, heads reversed (with red on neck, chest, rib and rump); brown bands above, between and below registers; incised blob rosette as filling ornament
Producer name: Attributed to the Circle of: Sophilos
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1888,0601.570.b and 1888,0601.570.c and belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1888,0601.570.a, 1888,0601.570.d and 1888,0601.570.g.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 257, no. B171) (identified as a loutrophoros)
Williams 1983 / Sophilos in the British Museum (p. 13, p. 15)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 225, no. 7a)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0269) (Phase 1)
